item.title: Report X-2023100554
item.description:
Report X-2023100554

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-28
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet. Upon inspection found 1 plastic pail of Denatured Alcohol 5-gal had a defective lid. The small lid of pail had a small hole in the middle that was leaking liquid content. Package had hazmat markings but no OP-900 or certificate to match TRK#. DescribePack: Plastic pail had defective lid that had a small hole in middle of small cap resulted leakage. Outer packaging was improper. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023100591
item.description:
Report X-2023100591

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-29
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet. Upon inspection found that the 1 plastic jerrican of Potassium Hydroxide Solution 18-liter had a defective lid. The lid was secure but was still leaking out of cap. DescribePack: Jerrican had a defective lid resulted to leakage. Cap was secure but was still leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023100584
item.description:
Report X-2023100584

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-29
  • City: DEFUNIAK SPRINGS
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: As pkg. was going down the van line, pkg. fell off due to may pkgs. still on the belt. Pkg. was taken to QA for inspection since it was identified a Hazmat. DescribePack: Upon further inspection, it was noted that 2 of the 4, gallon containers were dented on top causing liquid to leak. Pkg. had a Styrofoam topping but no partitions inside. Damage was cause because of the pkg. falling off the belt, prior to that, contents were in good shape. Orientation arrows were present on the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. was placed in the HWPA awaiting instructions from PGH.

The package was contained in a bag and bucket and immediately brought over to QA cage for processing. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The wet, leaking package was placed into a bag in a bucket and brought over to the QA cage area to be processed.

item.title: Report X-2023100331
item.description:
Report X-2023100331

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: COCOA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver gave 2 different accounts of the incident to QA and P&D. Initially, driver said that it fell out of his truck, but not while he was at a delivery stop or a pickup stop and he couldn't remember where it happened. He said that someone helped him hose down the liquid when they read that the material was called "Dishmachine Detergent." The driver gave the empty drum to QA and the inside of his truck was visible with pickups on the floor of the truck at that time. There were no additional damages from that Work Area. The following day, P&D was told that the spill occurred inside the delivery truck and that "they had hosed it down", but did not say when or where the spill occurred nor did they say who helped the driver clean up the truck since the Hazmat had been the only damaged package to return to the station. Only the empty drum was brought back, no cleanup material. DescribePack: Drum is scuffed and covered in sandy dirt. The lid appears to have come open partially or partially put back on after coming off. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Driver said someone helped him "hose it down", but not who or where or what was done with the cleanup material if any was used. Empty drum was brought back to the station.

item.title: Report X-2023100301
item.description:
Report X-2023100301

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-26
  • City: FORT MYERS
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While being handled the orientation was changed it was noticed to be leaking. DescribePack: The lid has a safety tab which is still intact however the lid is able to twist before the seal is broken and when its orientation is any position than up the pressure of the other bottle causes the contents to squeeze through the loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Kept orientation up, placed in a lined bin for processing. There is a corrosive marking on the box

DurationRel: 10 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. placed in bin and stored in the HWPA awaiting instructions from PGH.

item.title: Report X-2023090170
item.description:
Report X-2023090170

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T00:32:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-29
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Package was brought to the attention of the spill clean up specialist at our station location in Miami Florida when staining was seen indicating leaking inside the package. Package was found during the PM sort operations and was labeled as a UN 1993 Flammable Liquid n.o.s and Dry Ice. Package consisted of a fibreboard box overpack. Inside the fibreboard box was a Styrofoam box lined with a moisture barrier containing 3 jerricans of liquid commodity and 10 KG of dry ice. Inspection found the cap on one of the jerricans was loose and allowed for an estimated 1 liter of product to leak. It was instructed for liquid commodity placed in salvage drum to contain leak and dry ice to be removed. Consignee contacted for package retrieval.
